it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.transaction

Class CoapTransactionClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.transaction.CoapTransactionClient

  • public class CoapTransactionClient
extends java.lang.Object
    CoAP transaction client. It handles a client-side CoAP transaction.

    A transaction client is created by specifying:

    • the CoAP provider, used to send the request and receive the response,
    • the request message,
    • the destination socket address,
    • the transaction client listener.
    The request message is actually sent when the method request() is called. If the transaction client receives a response message within the transaction timeout, the response is passed to the transaction client listener through the method CoapTransactionClientListener.onTransactionResponse(CoapTransactionClient, CoapResponse), otherwise, in case the timeout expires, the method CoapTransactionClientListener.onTransactionFailure(CoapTransactionClient) is fired; only one of this two methods will be called, only one time.

    The transaction client automatically handles request retransmissions and duplicated response receptions.
